title: Compute interval for proportion with electric cars

content.question: The management team of a company with 10,000 employees is considering installing charging stations for electric cars in the company parking lots. In a random sample of 500 employees, 15 reported owning an electric car. Which of the following is a 99 percent confidence interval for the proportion of all employees at the company who own an electric car?

choices.label: 0.03 plus minus 2.326 square root of start fraction left parenthesis 0.03 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.97 right parenthesis over 500 end fraction end root
0.15 plus minus 2.326 square root of start fraction left parenthesis 0.15 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.85 right parenthesis over 500 end fraction end root
0.03 plus minus 2.576 square root of start fraction left parenthesis 0.03 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.97 right parenthesis over 500 end fraction end root
0.15 plus minus 2.576 square root of start fraction left parenthesis 0.15 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.85 right parenthesis over 500 end fraction end root

0.03 plus minus 2.576 square root of start fraction left parenthesis 0.03 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.97 right parenthesis over 500 end fraction plus start fraction left parenthesis 0.03 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.97 right parenthesis over 10,000 end fraction end root

content.answer: 0.03 plus minus 2.576 square root of start fraction left parenthesis 0.03 right parenthesis left parenthesis 0.97 right parenthesis over 500 end fraction end root

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
